alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a cyclic ether with three ring atoms(one oxygen and two carbon atoms).
alternative_parents.name: Epoxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the dialkyl ether functional group, with the formula ROR', where R and R' are alkyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkyl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts that results from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds formally derived from ammonia by replacing one, two or three hydrogen atoms by hydrocarbyl groups, and having the general structures RNH2 (primary amines), R2NH (secondary amines), R3N (tertiary amines).
alternative_parents.name: Amines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with a positive electric charge.
alternative_parents.name: Organic cations

class.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
class.name: Organonitrogen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as tetraalkylammonium salts. These are organonitrogen compounds containing a quaternary ammonium substituted with four alkyl chains.

direct_parent.description: Organonitrogen compounds containing a quaternary ammonium substituted with four alkyl chains.
direct_parent.name: Tetraalkylammonium salts

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing positively charged polyatomic ion of the structure NR4+, R being an alkyl group or an aryl group.
subclass.name: Quaternary ammonium salts

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
superclass.name: Organic nitrogen compounds
